body.p: The Standard requires that a biological asset should be measured at its fair value less estimated point‑of‑sale costs. Point‑of‑sale costs include commissions to brokers and dealers, levies by regulatory agencies and commodity exchanges, and transfer taxes and duties. Point‑of‑sale costs exclude transport and other costs necessary to get assets to a market. Such transport and other costs are deducted in determining fair value (that is, fair value is a market price less transport and other costs necessary to get an asset to a market).
